Pre-reqs: Either (a) all of ECON 101, ECON 102 or (b) ECON 100 or (c) all of ECON 310, ECON 311 or (d) all of ECON 101, ECON 311 or (e) all of ECON 102, ECON 310; and one of MATH 100, MATH 102, MATH 104, MATH 110, MATH 120, MATH 180, MATH 184.
Co-reqs: One of COMM 293, COMM 457.
Non-Commerce students only. It cannot be counted for credit in the BCom program. If you are unable to register in a section of this course and you have been admitted by your Faculty to the Minor in Commerce or another approved program in which this course is a requirement, you may submit a registration request using the form available on the Sauder website: https://mybcom.sauder.ubc.ca/courses-money-enrolment/courses-and-registration/registration-assistance .
Students not meeting any of the criteria within the restricted seats remaining will only be able to register if there are general seats available.
NOTE: Course registration is administered by the Sauder Undergraduate Office and NOT the instructor (DO NOT CONTACT THE INSTRUCTOR).
This section of COMM 473 is offered in a FLEX (flexible learning) format. Rather than attending traditional in-class lectures for three hours each week, students in the FLEX section will spend more time with online learning materials in preparation for fewer scheduled in-person meeting times. There will be in-class sessions every other week. The remainder of the course is conducted with the use of online learning materials, practice problems, and weekly quizzes, which will take you approximately three hours per week outside of class time to complete. Instructors will provide exact dates for in-class session times closer to the start of term.
